item.title: Bridge returned error 400! (18706)
item.content:encoded:
Twitter @TayAndersonCO was unable to receive or process the remote website's content!
Error message: `The requested resource cannot be found!
Please make sure your input parameters are correct!
cUrl error: (0)
PHP error: `
Query string: `action=display&bridge=Twitter&context=By+username&u=TayAndersonCO&norep=on&nopic=on&noimg=on&format=Atom`
Version: `dev.2020-02-26`

  • Press Return to check your input parameters
  • Press F5 to retry
  • Check if this issue was already reported on GitHub (give it a thumbs-up)
  • Open a GitHub Issue if this error persists

pmaziere
item.author: Tay Anderson

item.title: Denver Public Schools issued a statement last night in regards...
item.content:encoded:
Denver School Board Director - Tay Anderson

Denver Public Schools issued a statement last night in regards to the domestic terrorist attack in Atlanta on Tuesday.

Late Tuesday, eight people were murdered in Atlanta, Georgia and six of those individuals were Asian American women. These crimes are being investigated but appear to be racially motivated. For many of us, these murders bring to light the trauma, hate, and violence that Asian Americans are experiencing in our country. And this must stop.

We have marked the... one year anniversary of a world-wide pandemic that has taken 500,000 lives in America and disrupted the lives of every student and family in the District. In this same timeframe, hateful rhetoric and violence against Asian Americans has festered and grown. In this past year, over 3,800 xenophobic and racialized attacks against Asian Americans (mostly women and elderly) have been reported.

These racialized attacks against Asian Americans reflect our country‚Äôs painful and often overlooked historical mistreatment of Asian Americans, including the Chinese exclusion and Japanese incarceration. In Denver, we are mere steps away from the state‚Äôs Ralph Carr Justice Center, named for the former Colorado Governor who courageously refused to send Coloradans of Japanese descent to the federal incarceration camps during World War II. At the time under great political pressure, Governor Carr stated, ‚ÄúIf you harm them, you must first harm me.‚Äù

Racism has no place in our district. We are a district grounded in Equity. We are committed to ensuring our schools are Safe and Welcoming for all. And we stand with our Asian American students, staff, and families. We condemn these heinous acts of violence and hateful rhetoric. And we are committed to creating a safe place for our Asian American students and staff to learn and thrive.

See More
item.author: Tay Anderson

item.title: I refuse to apologize for not voting against the charter school...
item.content:encoded:
Denver School Board Director - Tay Anderson

I refuse to apologize for not voting against the charter school renewals we had last night.

Those 20,000 + students deserve the same treatment we give our district run students.
item.author: Tay Anderson

item.title: This page believes and promotes Black Lives Matter.
item.content:encoded:
Denver School Board Director - Tay Anderson

This page believes and promotes Black Lives Matter.
item.author: Tay Anderson

item.title: Last night we had someone come to our school board meeting...
item.content:encoded:
Denver School Board Director - Tay Anderson

Last night we had someone come to our school board meeting spewing lies about Black Lives Matter and how it doesn‚Äôt support ‚Äúfamily values‚Äù and called it ‚Äúmarxist‚Äù organization.

They also mentioned they didn‚Äôt find anywhere on the DPS website our support for Black Lives Matter.

I think I can speak freely for both DPS and the Board when I say this, we believe that Black Lives Matter and will support our Black educators and students in whatever way they need.

...

Remember All lives can‚Äôt matter until Black Lives Matter.

See More
item.author: Tay Anderson

item.title: When folks make comments like ‚ÄúBlack Lives Matter is a marxist...
item.content:encoded:
Denver School Board Director - Tay Anderson

When folks make comments like ‚ÄúBlack Lives Matter is a marxist organization.‚Äù

Simply turn on your camera so they can say it to your face. Denver Public Schools is a school district that believes that Black Lives Matter, now I will be cementing this in policy!
item.author: Tay Anderson

item.title: My response to the bigotry that took place in our School Board...
item.content:encoded:
Denver School Board Director - Tay Anderson

My response to the bigotry that took place in our School Board meeting today from a parent in our public comment session.

1.) Denver Public Schools believes Black Lives Matter!

2.) Wear a mask üò∑
item.author: Tay Anderson

item.title: Knock Knock ... PROM IS HERE!
item.content:encoded:
Denver School Board Director - Tay Anderson

Knock Knock ... PROM IS HERE!

It may not look like the prom pre-pandemic, but Colorado students will likely be able to attend the traditional spring dance this year.

thedenverchannel.com

The prom is back: Colorado schools receive guidance for 2021

It may not look like the prom pre-pandemic, but Colorado students will likely be able to attend the traditional spring dance this year.It may not look like the prom pre-pandemic, but Colorado students will likely be able to attend the traditional spring dance this year.
item.author: Tay Anderson

item.title: After much thought and consideration I will vote for the staff...
item.content:encoded:
Denver School Board Director - Tay Anderson

After much thought and consideration I will vote for the staff recommendation to begin the school year on 8/23.

It does NOT address all of the concerns that I have in regards heat mitigation and lack of ventilation in our schools, however I believe we can take the next two school years to ramp up air conditioning units and begin working with other school districts to join us and pushing their calendars back.

If we see the same heat crisis arise as we did the year before last, I will be an advocate in re-opening this conversation in the fall. I want to thank our teams in Denver Public Schools that worked with me and heard my concerns to bring this recommendation forward as a middle ground.
item.author: Tay Anderson

item.title: White Supremacy has yet again struck our nation. My heart goes...
item.content:encoded:
Denver School Board Director - Tay Anderson

White Supremacy has yet again struck our nation.

My heart goes out to those in the AAPI community as they mourn the loss of eight incredible souls that were unjustly taken from us.

This was an act of domestic terrorism.

...

The AAPI community stood with us in defense of Black lives and now we must do the same.

Instead of mentioning or showing the domestic terrorist by name or picture, let‚Äôs uplift those whom we have lost and find ways to support their families when asked.

Director Tay Anderson

See More
item.author: Tay Anderson

item.title: Community, On Thursday we will vote on the new school calendar...
item.content:encoded:
Denver School Board Director - Tay Anderson

Community,

On Thursday we will vote on the new school calendar and I will be honest I am torn.

Our district staff heard the concerns that I and others put forward and moved to the middle with a start date of 8/23.

...

An 8/23 start date is one week later than originally proposed and will preserve all breaks, but I heard you very clearly on wanting an 8/30 start date which would start us two weeks later and would reduce thanksgiving and winter break. (BOTH will have an impact on heat Ôøº mitigation one more than the other)

This is a big decision and I need your help as someone that represents ALL of Denver.

See More
item.author: Tay Anderson

item.title: DENVER PUBLIC SCHOOLS UPDATE: We will return to in-person...
item.content:encoded:
Denver School Board Director - Tay Anderson

DENVER PUBLIC SCHOOLS UPDATE:

We will return to in-person learning on March 17th, 2021. Please be safe as you return to work/school.

item.title: DENVER PUBLIC SCHOOLS UPDATE: Due to the extreme amount of...
item.content:encoded:
Denver School Board Director - Tay Anderson

DENVER PUBLIC SCHOOLS UPDATE:

Due to the extreme amount of snowfall during this weekend‚Äôs storm and the difficult travel conditions created the past two days, we will keep all school and office buildings closed on Tuesday, March 16.

We will follow the guidance previously shared, and have a day of fully remote learning for our students and fully remote work for our staff.
item.author: Tay Anderson

item.title: Today I had an amazing time with our students, parents, and...
item.content:encoded:
Denver School Board Director - Tay Anderson

Today I had an amazing time with our students, parents, and educators for a snowball tournament in Central Park.

Let‚Äôs just say the students won, but this was a memory I will treasure for a lifetime.
